bug.author: vitaly-d
bug.summary: ner_jsonl2json() got an unexpected keyword argument 'seg_sents'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
The 'jsonl2json' convertor fails with the "got an unexpected keyword argument" message: To reproduce: python -m spacy convert -c jsonl --lang en sample.jsonl /tmp Nothing interesting within sample.jsonl, the behaviour does not depend on its content. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/files/3696608/sample.jsonl.zip>sample.jsonl.zip</denchmark-link>
After modifying the signature of ner_jsonl2json, my large dataset was converted without any issues: <denchmark-code>(.env) vitaly@iMac spaCy % git diff diff --git a/spacy/cli/converters/jsonl2json.py b/spacy/cli/converters/jsonl2json.py index 91dd4298..c6abc487 100644 --- a/spacy/cli/converters/jsonl2json.py +++ b/spacy/cli/converters/jsonl2json.py @@ -7,7 +7,9 @@ from ...gold import docs_to_json from ...util import get_lang_class, minibatch
-def ner_jsonl2json(input_data, lang=None, n_sents=10, use_morphology=False): +def ner_jsonl2json( + input_data, lang=None, n_sents=10, use_morphology=False, seg_sents=None, model=None +): if lang is None: raise ValueError("No --lang specified, but tokenization required") json_docs = [] </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.2.1 Platform: Darwin-19.0.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.7.3

comments.comment: Thanks, it's hard to keep all of the CLI stuff tested. I think it's best to add a **kwargs catch-all, in case arguments are added for other converters that don't apply.
